{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has poor control of her type 1 diabetes, which can lead to hyperglycemia. Hyperglycemia during organogenesis, which occurs during the first 10 weeks of gestation, can lead to various congenital malformations. The most common malformations associated with maternal diabetes are cardiac and neural tube defects. Given the options, spina bifida, a type of neural tube defect, is the most likely congenital abnormality in this case.", "answer_choice": "C. Spina bifida"}
